dependencies.description:
Datasets is a lightweight library providing two main features: one-line
dataloaders for many public datasets and efficient data pre-processing.
dependencies.name: py-datasets

dependencies.description:
Python Fire is a library for automatically generating command line
interfaces (CLIs) with a single line of code.
dependencies.name: py-fire

dependencies.description:
The OpenAI Python library provides convenient access to the OpenAI API
from applications written in the Python language. It includes a pre-
defined set of classes for API resources that initialize themselves
dynamically from API responses which makes it compatible with a wide
range of versions of the OpenAI API.
dependencies.name: py-openai

dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.
dependencies.name: py-pandas

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
Read key-value pairs from a .env file and set them as environment
variables
dependencies.name: py-python-dotenv

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: tiktoken is a fast BPE tokeniser for use with OpenAI's models.
dependencies.name: py-tiktoken

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description:
AlpacaFarm is a simulator that enables research and development on
learning from feedback at a fraction of the usual cost, promoting
accessible research on instruction following and alignment.
dependent_to.name: py-alpaca-farm

description:
An automatic evaluator for instruction-following language models. Human-
validated, high-quality, cheap, and fast.
name: py-alpaca-eval

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
